mods.abstract: This is a letter to an unknown person dated April 6, 1831. The author is probably Adam Fergusson. Fergusson is writing about what he sees as the growing corruption in government and particularly politicians. Fergusson believes that elected officials are misusing their power against people whose opinions differ from their own. He writes that many people are outraged by a recently passed law. Fergusson believes that all Congressmen should take oaths of loyalty to the U.S. constitution and the Tennessee constitution. He mentions the Alen family that has gained control over many local offices of trust. Fergusson believes that this monopoly is harmful to the other citizens of the county. Fergusson gives some new information pertaining to a recent scandal involving defalcation, Colonel Parrish, a Mr. Cooper and the State Bank.
